Reviews.Title: “Probably wouldn't again....”
Reviews.Author: Amellia_7
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel on March 16th for a St Pattys day weekend in Boston. When we checked in we were told that a bus tour had just arrived and the hotel was sold out. Our room we booked (2 doubles and a pull out) was no longer available. We were given 1 King bed with a pull out. No explanation really other than the hotel was sold out and this was all we could get. We had 4 people in our room and the pull outs are only a single. 3 of us had to share a king bed all weekend to save sleeping on the floor. The rooms were ok - clean but basic. Local isn't bad either - close to Fenway and all the local bars and shopping. I probably wouldn't stay here again given what had happened.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Boston Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: cruisetraveline
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe, great location. Easy 30 minute walk to the convention center 1.6 miles away. Much lower in cost than the typical convention hotel too! Service was great. My room was very clean and nicely appointed. MBTA stop only a block away!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: St3f
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only for one night. The service was ok, and breakfast was included. Rooms were really spacious and clean. There was also free wifi and parking. I don't know much about the location cause next morning we left rushing very early to go downtown. The price was ok, about hundred bucks, if i remember correctly. Would stay there again, would also recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Smelly, Unsafe, etc.”
Reviews.Author: WheresAnn
Reviews.Content: I've tried to be as specific as possible for other travelers. I also hope that when Best Western management see this review, it will help to identify areas in which they can improve. Poorly maintained historic 'round' (hence the name Roundhouse) hotel located in a high traffic and industrial area in Roxbury. Very loud and noisy and currently, the trash dumpster get emptied around 2:30am. At least that was the schedule for the days/nights I was there. Large trucks with their back-up beepers blaring 24/7. Close to hospital, so blaring sirens 24/7 also. Very limited parking. Area is prone to lots of foot traffic...park at your own risk! Did NOT feel safe walking from my car to the entrance at night. Busy gas station next door with bright lights. Curtains did not block out the light during the night. Drafty, ill-fit windows allowed cold wind to blow directly in as well as all traffic noise. I used the couch cushions to try and stop the cold air, but it did not work. Unclean and stale smoke smell through out the entire hotel. When you first walk in (manual doors with NO handicap opener) you can smell freshly baked cookies...I thought UMMMM, UMMMM! But as you ride up in the elevator and step onto the floors...your greeted with dim lighting, dark decor, and smoke. The smell in the rooms only gets worse... Internet is slow and I was unable to sustain connectivity for work purposes and I ended up using my personal air card. Stained and peeling wallpaper throughout the hotel, broken tiles in the bathrooms, towel bar falling off the wall, broken lid on back of commode, broken curtain rods, torn curtains, rust stains in the tubs, broken toilet, and I had a leaning toilet! Carpet is filthy. I kicked my shoes off when I came in....ended up throwing my socks away because they were black! Sheets are well worn, but at that comfy stage instead of stiff and starchy. Toiletries not restocked. Had to go to front desk to get shampoo! The little two-room suite are large enough. Has a nice size desk, newer desk chair, small microwave and fridge. Older model TV's and even a small safe in the armoire.

Reviews.Title: “Good nice hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: FARI_PTY
Reviews.Content: We get to the hotel very late at night, but check in was easy. They got free wifi, complimentary fairly complete breakfast, which includes waffles, bagels, sausage and egg, among other stuff. Their free businnes center is fairly complete. Rooms are very nice. Its located in front of a McDonalds. The building is well kept historical one but the surrounding neighborhood is not the best, but is ok. I get a room at 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “if you are a rewards member, and can get the 6th floor, do it!”
Reviews.Author: 8nqDh62V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a less than desirable area on the Boston / Roxbury line. I was lucky enough to get the 6th floor, reserved for rewards members and was very happy with the layout and features of the small suite until I make it to the bed. What a shame! The linens were as old as the hills and were pilled, course and simply uncomfortable. The pillows were equally poor and lumpy. But somehow I managed to get about 6 hours of sleep and make my way to the extremely average and unremarkable continental breakfast. The airport shuttle wasn't running and the hotel requires a reservation the day ahead of your need so be warned. They do have a local shuttle to drop you at a T station or bus station however. The staff was extremely friendly. Parking is free but the area is dark and open season on some of the less than desirable people milling about the area so be careful what you park there. Kudos on a nice 6th floor for rewards member and an imaginative floor plan for this very round house hotel. Major demerits for the sheets and pillows. Arguable the worse that I have ever slept on. Hopefully the owners will take care of this as they clearly take care of this property. For me the real win was the managers special. it made it all worthwhile, well not the bed linens, they were AWFUL.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place and best for rewards members”
Reviews.Author: an_der_KL
Reviews.Content: About the hotel: This hotel is a historic round building which is pretty cool to look and has been kept really well. We stayed at this hotel over the weekend of dec2-4 and were upgraded to the 6th (Rewards Members) floor which is one of a kind and I haven't seen in any other BW properties I've stayed so far. The room is really huge - the living space and the bed room is separated by a french door. The living room has a flat screen tv and the bed room also has a flat screen tv.The living room has a table/chair, sofa and a small kitchenette (Sink/Microwave/Refrigerator). Though the room looks old but it has kept really clean.This room also comes with 3 phones - one in each room and in the bathroom. Near the lobby, they had a business center with two computers but we haven't used them. They also had three vending machines and one among them is hot food (fries/pizza) which was cool but we haven't used it. Bed/Pillows: The linens were very old and I wish they update bed linens and the pillows also need a replacement. Breakfast: They have a complimentary breakfast - coffee/Juice/Cereals/Bagels/Muffins/Fresh Fruits and waffle maker where you can make your own hot waffles. We were at the breakfast area around 9AM and it was crowded but we could find a table. I also read a sign that they have extra seating area in the lower area and which is not bad at all. Tip: If you are in the rewards floor, you can request your breakfast(limited - not the warm stuff) delivered to your room and you can also specify the time frame. We did try for one day and they delivered it to the room at the time we have requested, spot ON! Shuttle Service: The hotel also provides complimentary shuttle service to near by train stations and restaurants which is a great service. We did use the service and they were punctual when we asked for a pickup from a near by restaurant. Parking: They have a open parking across the street, make sure you get a pass and have it on your dashboard displayed so that you can avoid your vehicle from getting towed. Staff: The front desk people are friendly and they tried to help you if you have any questions. Location: This hotel is located in the southern side of Boston city. Like others mentioned, this is not in a fantastic neighborhood but in a location where you can easily get around. Right across the street, they had McDonald's, pizza place and a gas station. Check-in/Checkout: It was easy, no hassle. They asked me if I'm interested to get a gift basket as being a rewards member or 250 points, i chose to get the basket. It has come with - a pack of chips, a cookie and bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “NOT in BOSTON”
Reviews.Author: momof2boys_KK
Reviews.Content: First thing to know, this hotel is NOT in Boston. It is in Roxbury, which borders Boston but is very different. That would be okay, but the shuttle service itself was not very convenient. It was useful and we did use it, but because they are serving so many customers with so many stops, it was not convenient. When we first arrived we took the shuttle to 'convention center' which to me meant the Hines convention center T-stop just a straight shot from the hotel down Mass Ave. But another couple wanted to go to the boston convention center on the water, which is where we went first. Then the driver didn't want to take us to Hines because it was so far away. He DID bring us to Copley (which is where we ultimately wanted to go), but I don't know why it was such a negotiation. The rooms were small but clean. If you are paranoid about cleanliness in a hotel, you will be pleased. Plastic cups were wrapped in plastic. Beds were triple sheeted. Last, we were surprised when we opened up the sofa bed for our 2 boys and saw no sheets or linens. It turns out they provide a 'bed in bag' in the room with everything to set up the sofa bed. That way you know the linens are fresh. I always worry that housekeepers don't always change the linens on sofa beds. You just have to do it yourself. I wish I had realized that though because I called down to the front desk to request linens and waited over a half hour for somebody to show up when it turns out the linens were in our room the whole time. The downside of the sofa bed was that it was a TWIN bed, and I had 2 boys sleeping on it. My boys are young so it was fine, but if you have older children, you will only be able to fit one person on the sofa bed. The hotel does not have roll away beds. Breakfast was good. Standard waffles. No eggs other than hard boiled and no other warm items. However, when we arrived at breakfast all of the tables were taken, so we stood and waited. The staff sent us downstairs to another room, but when we got there it was locked. So, we went back upstairs and waited. One of the biggest complaints is the lack of tv programming. There was only 1 kids station available, and when we went to it, all we saw was the direct tv icon swirling around the screen. But, you can BUY kids shows for $4 each for a 30 minute show! I was desperate so I did, but the idea of having to pay anything for a PBS kids show is absolutely ridiculous. I complained to the front desk, and they said there was nothing they could do because it was contracted by an outside company. I didn't dispute the charge - I did agree to pay for it, but that's just madness. If you are looking for an inexpensive, clean place to stay, this is it. But, the location is awful and the service is just so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service Yes”
Reviews.Author: Nicole001
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a smile and I will be with you in a minute, people don't mind waiting when they are acknowledged. Our key did not work so we had to return to the reception, for our trouble we were upgraded to a higher floor. Rooms are nice and clean. Breakfast was good. The shuttle was available when we needed it. Unfortunately you can hear noises from the street and you are close to a hospital (ambulances and sirens).

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and great breakfast hostess”
Reviews.Author: Nedrabeau G G
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerks, Tiara and Joel were so friendly and helpful. The room was large with a couch. The breakfast had the best hostess, Carol that I have ever encountered. And the breakfast had all the choices you could want available. The hotel shuttle was available when we needed it and drivers were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Yul
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights over the Columbus Day weekend and we had a good stay overall. Looking at previous reviews, itâ€™s true that itâ€™s not a downtown location or in a trendy neighbourhood, and yes you can hear some noise from the street but this hotel has a lot going for it: good service, decent size rooms for 5, easy to get to and from, close enough to what you want to do or see, free breakfast + parking and very reasonable rates. Indeed, hotels were booked solid for that weekend and the prices for â€˜downtownâ€™ locations were way too much for a family with 3 children and they did not even include breakfast at those sky high prices. I would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel and they have a great continental breakfast. We will stay there again. The counter person, Tiara, went out of her way to see that all of our needs were met. There was a problem with getting a prompt response from the maintenance area. We stayed there three days, I told a desk person of two problems, one of the TV remotes did not work and the shower head needed to be replaced because water was barely coming out of the shower head and what water was coming out was squarting out the side and damaging the wall. There was just enough water coming out to take a shower. The desk person said he would take care of it, but he didn't. I complained the next morning to Tiara, she arranged for themaintenance person to come up to check it out. I showed him what was happening and he said he would replace the shower head. This did not happen. We were there 3 nights and the shower head problem was not addressed, although the batteries in the TV remote were replaced and it did function properly after that. On check-out, I again told Tiara that the shower head problem was not corrected, she apologized and gave me a slight rate discount for this inconvience. It is my opinion that Tiara is an outstanding employee and was a great help to us within her scope of responsibility. Its just too bad that the maintenance side of the house didn't come through as Tiara had. That aside, it is a good hotel to stay at and I would overlook the above problems and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: lambs1
Reviews.Content: Although this facility is somewhat dated, it is as clean as a whistle, the bed was very comfortable, and the breakfast had much to pick from. Tiara is a treasure on the front desk, she was very helpful and went the extra mile to help us get from here to there and then to the airport on the shuttle. She is a gem and Best Western is lucky to have her. We had good luck with the shuttle service - My only complaint was the noise - I don't know what it was - sounded like a truck backing up with the beep beep - but it was before midnight - the second night I took some melatonin and heard nothing!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but in loud neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Sockerkaka
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and clean, but the beds were small (full rather than queens) and the noise from the street was disturbingly loud with ambulances passing by frequently through the night. The free shuttle bus was very convenient, but as a family with small children we would have appreciated more to have a hotel restaurant/bar and a nice neighborhood with walking distance to local restaurants. The breakfast was OK, access to the hotel by car is very convenient, free parking is great as well as free Wi-Fi. None the less, I will probably chose a different hotel the next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Terri P
Reviews.Content: By far the best thing about the Roundhouse Suites is Tiara at the front desk. She's a treasure! I was in Boston for a medical trip. Most of the hotels were full at the fairly short notice I booked. Wasn't sure what to expect from the hotel from reviews. The first experience of attempting to change the room type by email sent to the hospitality manager wasn't good since no one answered. Called and that was remedied. Next experience wasn't too good either as the airport shuttle didn't show up. Apparently you need to get a confirmation email from the driver. He claimed never to have received it. BUT from there on the experience got very positive VERY quickly! We were told to take a taxi from the airport which Tiara deducted from the room charge. I have a thing about ground floor rooms and though there was nothing wrong with the room we got she changed us WITH A SMILE to a higher room. The complimentary breakfast is very good. The nice lady who deals with breakfast is REALLY efficient. She keeps things flowing but get there on time because she efficiently packs away too ;-) The complimentary shuttle around town is excellent. The guys are REALLY accommodating and they give you a realistic time when they can arrive. Only had one incident with the shuttle and the amazing Tiara was around to fix that for us too. My brother actually used the gym. There's a great mall within walking distance. We also got stuck in Boston due to Hurricane Maria closing the airport. Danielle arranged for us to stay in our room which was a blessing. Great hotel. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimmiranda
Reviews.Content: My daughter attends school in Boston and I visit her often. I always stay at the Roundhouse suites. The location is convienent and has parking. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly and eager to help. Tiarn at the front desk is amazing. She is friendly and always very helpful and efficient. Thank you Tiarn..see you soon! Kim Miranda

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Manon24
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples, and we did not know what to expect! The room was nice, and big enough with a separate living room with a sofa. Nice shuttle to the Fenway park. Nice breakfast. Would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Really not bad...”
Reviews.Author: Hunterspointers
Reviews.Content: The hotel has clean new rooms and very courteous staff. The neighborhood is not as bad as people have made it out to be. It's not different from most changing urban areas. We walked a few blocks and back at night to a wonderful Senegalese Restaurant and did not at all feel threatened. Parking was ample and I felt less isolated in the auxiliary lot . Breakfast was decent though starchy and lacked herbal tea. The main complaint was that there was a steady whirring from within the ventilation system. All in all a very good value for being close to downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The location is HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: BDKR
Reviews.Content: We felt pretty cheated by our stay in Boston, as this hotel was in a truly horrible location. It is located next to an industrial area on a very busy intersection. It was walking distance to nothing, and the free shuttle was so infrequent that we ended up driving or taking taxis to be able to get around in a timely manner. The worst part though was that we arrived on a weekend, so it was pretty quiet for a night. But first thing Monday morning (at 4 am!!), a whole bunch of noisy trucks started working on a lot nearby. It sounded like a garbage transfer station or big construction site. Every weekday morning it was the same thing. The room itself was big enough, but the sofabed was unusable (no bedding!), and there were springs poking out. The decor was dated and the whole place just felt grimy. The breakfast station in the mornings was so poorly laid out that nobody could move, and there was not enough seating. NOT recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so nice area”
Reviews.Author: Ivinsart
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the two room suite just wonderful. However, they had a very small parking lot. You could park nearby for free "at your own risk". We did not feel safe venturing outside the hotel except to jump into a cab to go downtown. They have a shuttle van but it does not go downtown, so we had to use a cab the whole time. Still cheaper than the parking lot fees downtown if you can find a parking spot. We did take a walk when we first arrived to find something to eat. The only thing in walking distance was a macdonalds that was under construction. The savings in staying farther away from downtown just wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jennyseto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July/11 and had a very clean spacious room. Maid service was excellent. The breakfast was plentiful and parking/shuttle were excellent too. We used the shuttle to take us to the Prudential Centre and from there walked or took the subway to our destination for the day. The shuttle pick up from there back to the hotel was prompt too. I'd highly recommend this hotel in Boston, it's a lot less expensive to stay here than downtown Boston and the service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for hotel after night at Fenway!”
Reviews.Author: Ted329
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roundhouse on a Friday night, after going to a Red Sox game at Fenway. The hotel is a little bit further from Fenway than I would have like to have stayed, but it was very clean, had a free shuttle, free breakfast and is a suites hotel. The area where the hotel is, isn't the greatest but it's a city so really should be expected...The shuttle is very crowded and busy, but it's FREE so it's ok...The breakfast food was fine, the area to eat is really the lobby and just can't accomodate the amount of people who want to eat, we took our food back to our room which worked out. The staff was pleasant and answered any questions and needs. We did have our car with us and the parking was also free, just not alot of spots, most people are allowed to park in the gas station parking lot behind the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: a5689
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the roundhouse for two nights and loved every second of it. From the minute we walked in we were warmly welcomed and treated to the fresh cookie hour. We were assigned a room on the fifth floor, room 517. The room was spotless and was a great size for being in the city area, with the price paid. Two beds and sofa with refrig, microwave, chair, sink outside bathroom. However the first night the A/C went out in our room. We went down for breakfast and reported the issue to the desk. No questions asked, they upgraded us to the Best western rewards sixth floor. Most hotels would try and "fix it" they wasted no time. These rooms were even better than the others with lcd TVs and upgraded shower accessories. The breakfast was great to get started with standard continental pastries, breads, juice, coffee, with added yogurt and waffles. I would like to address two issues raised with previous users. The area/ safety. This hotel is in a city. For anyone who lives in/ near a city and who has visited many cities will know that there will be homeless people wandering around. They do not pose a safety issue; they will not bother you, and treat them like anyone else. For those who said that they were scared to walk to their car I was amazed that they stayed at the same hotel. I was out walking around at 10/11 at night. It reminded me of a typical city at night, everyone minding their own business, no safety risk. Some made it sound like it was in the middle of the ghetto. The shuttle was the other point. It is great. What other hotel will take you for free to some place in a city? Stop complaining, you had to wait twenty minutes, boo hoo, itâ€™s free, take what you get and be lucky. If it is bothersome drive yourself or stay at the four seasons. The shuttle is very reliable all you have to do is call and they will give you a time estimate, and you can go around shop while waiting. We had them take us to prudential center everyday to pick up the old town trolley and it worked out fantastic, no need to pay to ride metro. This hotel is truly great. It is affordable and will even take you for free to go and eat or to metro. What better service can you ask for in the innner city? The free parking is just more of an added plus along with big suites for around 175 including tax a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to use for Fenway games”
Reviews.Author: harleydteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here hoping to be conveniently located to Fenway and were not disappointed! They shuttled us close enough to walk to the park and picked us up after the game to get us back. This alone saved our party of 15 big bucks!! The parking is free which saves even more and a free breakfast is icing on the cake. Being in the city can get expensive and this hotel helps cut "hidden" costs. The rooms were large and fit all 6 of my family members comfortably. It was a clean and friendly place which will get my business again and again. The only drawback was the cramped breakfast "nook" with a frustrated worker who was having a hard time refilling the food shelves. But, it was free- so what's there to complain about really??!

Reviews.Title: “Don't park here”
Reviews.Author: TapsaM
Reviews.Content: A little bit noisy (trafic) average level hotel with pretty large rooms. Veeery low wifi connection was disappointment. Worst thing was that somebody hit our car's window with a rock during nighttime. Beside there was also another car with broken window. There was glass overall at parking lot so this kind of things seems to happen there. Roundhouse Suites should really do something to security.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with easy access to the city...”
Reviews.Author: Sliver799
Reviews.Content: After a lot of searching for a hotel in Boston that was worth a recreational 2 day trip, we chose the Best Western mainly because it was affordable and they tote free parking. In comparison to other hotels closer to the city center (charging $35-$45 a day), the Roadhouse gives the option of free parking with a free courtesy shuttle (that will take you to certain drop stops within a 2 mile radius or so). That was enough for us to book the hotel. While it is not in the greatest section of town (right next to the medical center) and the parking lot is an old lot across the street), the friendly staff made up for the location. Everyone from the front desk to the shuttle drivers were very helpful, accessible and friendly. The rooms were of typical Best Western suites (a little dated, but good size, comes with a refrigerator, microwave, free wi-fi etc. and it looked like they had bed bug covers on the mattress which is always a good sign that they are doing the best to keep guests comfortable--coming from NYC, bed bugs are troublesome). One of the helpful features is the shuttle service, which takes you to a couple subway stops as well as the Prudential Center (which also has a T-stop). The shuttle does get busy so there is generally a 20 minute wait, however, once it gets you to where you are going, all of Boston is accessible (either via walking or the subway). All in all, for the convenience of no hassle parking and no hassle transportation, the hotel was well worth our money for our 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, convenient for visiting Boston without the $$$!”
Reviews.Author: okazon69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for one night before a convention in Boston (we moved to another hotel for that). The hotel is very conveniently located near the Interstate, provides free on-site parking (rare in Boston!), free breakfast with a decent choice of things to eat. The room was spacious and comfortable, everything was clean and reasonably well taken care of. The area around the hotel is not the best, so walking around at night is probably not recommended. However, you're less than two miles from downtown Boston, so for location/convenience/price, this place can't be beat. This hotel had the fastest Internet access speed I have ever seen at a hotel: something like 15 MBPS down and 9 MBPS up! Impressive. Apart from a slow checkin due to the large number of people waiting, everything went well at this hotel and I'd be happy to return on another occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Boston vacation”
Reviews.Author: LHelker
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with interesting history. Very accommodating staff - went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable (especially Tiara when we checked in). The room was a nice size; our 7-year-old had the living room and TV to herself. The bed was very comfy. If the hotel were one mile north, it would have cost at least $100 more. GOOD breakfast. Free parking - limited at building, but in 2 adjacent lots that were well lit. The location is in a somewhat industrial/business part of town, without an attractive view, but it's very close to downtown and historical Boston, and the free shuttles will get you into town. We felt quite safe there. We'll stay there again when we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: bpwilson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your basic Best Western. It was clean, the bed was nice, and breakfast was good. We felt that the historic downtown was relatively close. We walked about 5 blocks and hopped on the bus. We were in the heart of downtown in about 15 minutes. They do have limited parking. The additional parking is behind the hotel at a gas station. We were very happy to get a spot next to the actual hotel (only 6 available). We arrived early (8 am) on the day of check-in and they allowed us to park our car, have breakfast, and gave us a map for site seeing. The shuttle was also available to us but we wanted to walk a bit and see the city. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: tracyc1166
Reviews.Content: Limited parking is the only downside to this hotel. We were lucky to find a spot and stayed. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the hotel is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rooms but a bit isolated”
Reviews.Author: Duddoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. The rooms were good and the bed comfortable. There was a sofa bed for my son. The wi-fi was excellent and the breakfast was standard continental fare with a waffle maker. The neighborhood is very industrial with only a McDonalds nearby and a couple of gas stations. It is difficult to get to town from here. The Best Western has a shuttle bus (gets crowded early) to the Prudential center which takes about 20 minutes to get to. The bus does pick you up from there as well. If you turn right from the BW entrance and walk 5-6 blocks on Mass. Avenue you can connect up with a silver line bus to Tufts Medical Center and catch the orange line from there. The staff was very friendly and quite knowledgable

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - but don't rely on shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Kiralou22
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the BW Roundhouse at the end of May, 2011. I tend to favor BW hotels for their value (price + type of accomodation). You cannot go wrong chosing to stay here based on rate and really decent free breakfast. My one caveat would be not to rely on being able to fully utilize the shuttle. During our stay, the hotel had only one shuttle. If you're not in a hurry to go somewhere and can wait for them, it's a good service, but you must plan it out. Additionally, the staff is not able to reliably tell you when you will go or be picked up. Having been told it was not wise to walk from the nearest subway exit to the hotel (1/2 mile?) at night, we stood at its exit almost an hour waiting for pickup, being told initially that it would be 10 minutes and after we called back after 25 minutes had passed only to be told it would be another 10 minutes. That seemed to be their pat reply. So, my suggestion would be that you could start your day off being dropped at the subway by the shuttle, but then take a taxi back. In fairness, I wish to say that all the staff were pleasant and tried to be helpful, but it seemed like the communication regarding pickup or arrival time between the shuttle driver and the staff was unrealistic. We were also there during a busy college graduation weekend, so, perhaps during more regular times the shuttle service is more reliable. FYI - they have a contract for airport shuttle service, but you cannot take their shuttle to the train station if you're arriving/leaving via train. You must take a taxi. The area is also a bit noisy as there is a major Boston hospital just a few blocks away. If you're a light sleeper, just bring some ear plugs. I'm not a light sleeper and I didn't use ear plugs and don't recall being woken up from any noise, either inside or outside the hotel. So, I would not let the thought of noise deter you from staying at the Roundhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service really made a nice difference...”
Reviews.Author: powergator
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay we had recently. The rooms are very efficiently organized because the hotel is literally built into a brick storage vessel that was used for natural gas storage (had no idea). There are actually a few across the country. I have to sayevery interaction with employees was always above and beyond with regard to their courtesy and accomadating style. We asked for a crib extra sheets and for a couple of shuttle rides that were not advertised and they met our every request. The area is located is close to several key locations for sports, tours, etc. But, the area is also not the best as far as its proximity to some industry and probably not fully crime free (particularly the parking area that is detached from the main hotel property by about a block. But for the value, they more than made up for this perception with nice clean rooms and a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston hotel if not location.”
Reviews.Author: POLLYANNA57
Reviews.Content: The BW Roundhouse Suites is a good hotel with very friendly and obliging staff, especially Wilfredo, Pablo and all of the hotel's own Shuttle Bus drivers. We had a hire car and we chose the Roundhouse because it had Free Parking, and the hotel itself had earned good (deserved) praise and we have BW loyalty membership. The parking for the Roundhouse was across the road from the hotel, but area was well lighted at night and as valuables should never be visible or left in vehicles anywhere anyway, we had no problem. The free breakfast available was good. Wide and plentiful choice and availability of food. Cleanliness of this hotel is impeccable. Our party of parents and adult child and partner, in two suites on the top (sixth) floor, all agreed the Roundhouse is a great hotel, if not the area. The suite fitouts were quite lovely. Bedroom and bathroom areas are roomy and separate small sitting area with couch, coffee table, desk and the wet bar of mini-frig, sink, small bench with coffee maker and microwave. Very useful. A TV in the bedroom and one in the sitting room also appreciated. Lighting, both natural and from fixtures was very good. The area, Roxbury, I would describe as on the outer ring of the Boston central business/tourist district. Another large hotel is across the road, and the Boston Hospital is probably 2 blocks away so the Roundhouse is by no means out in the suburbs but it is not within walking distance of the old historical parks and buildings of Boston. It is not near a T or any other public transport. We were aware of the Roundhouse's location from an older TA critique, for which I was grateful. Previous mention had been made of the area being dodgy (dangerous). It probably is. Most certainly at night. . The hotel's shuttle bus and free parking are its strongpoint, pertinent to the area and Boston's traffic. The younger ones used the shuttle constantly in and out of the city, day and night and really appreciated the service. My husband and I had not presumed we would use the hotel's shuttle bus a lot, but we too did use it a lot and it was a wonderful service, always available and so easy. Mostly we had Wilfredo driving us and he and other drivers are exceptional at what they do and so pleasant and helpful. We caught a few taxis too in Boston central which were very cheap back to the hotel. Approx. $10. For 2 or somethimes the four of us that was cheap.. We loathed Boston traffic, maniacal drivers and the daunting layout of the city and airport freeways etc., Scary stuff. I think my husband could compete in Indy after driving through, around and near Boston. A surprising number of Bostonians agreed with us on the unpleasant driving conditions. Our quite new Sat Nav obviously shared our horror as it died after day one in Boston. The hotel staff advised us where we could buy a new Sat Nav. There is a small shopping centre down Massachusetts Ave., a 10 minute easy walk from the hotel. There was a Target, Shoe outlet, Grocery store and a Best Buys, where we bought a new Sat Nav. Along the way there were a couple of restaurants/diners and immediately across the road from the Roundhouse is a Pizza and Italian takeaway shop and a MacDonalds next door to it as well as a Fuel Station next door to the Roundhouse. However exercise caution being out on the streets there late at night. Our young ones went over to MacDonalds late one night and the 6 foot tall male said he had never been so terrified in his life. He said the locals whilst obviously suffering various forms of substance abuse were enormous men - over 6 Ft 4 giants and of frightening appearance. But the children did stress they were very polite. Whilst they were begging for money. Even on the sixth floor we were aware of the noise of police sirens and lights and odd goings on during the nights. It didn't bother any of us unduly then. A fortnight after our first stay we had an unexpected return to the Roundhouse due to all flights out of Boston being cancelled by the unfortunate tragedy of the tornado. So very late at night we ended up back at the Roundhouse Hotel grateful to get a room, on the third floor. Our initial joy albeit after the day from Hell at the airport, was quenched by the street noise that night. I suspect the lower floors guest rooms facing Mass Ave., do have street noise level issues. However after seeing during Duck and Trolley tours, the locations of many of the hotels I had trawled before deciding on the BW Roundhouse Suites, and that only the most horrendously expensive were right in the central business district, I am glad we stayed at the Roundhouse Suites. Also I could not ever contemplate paying $US 48 a day for car parking, on top of the room rate! A huge recommendation for a restaurant. Petit Robert's Bistro on Columbus St. We had one big dinner there for the 4 of us. Everyone impressed. All meals eaten by our party were wonderful, but strongly recommend the half roast chicken meal.My husband and I subsequently returned there for a very late impromptu dinner after our flights home had been cancelled. Was only good thing about not flying home as scheduled. The very busy staff are lovely and attentive. Faultless service, great venue, excellent value for money, a perfect experience. There are also two other Petit Robert's elsewhere in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: GillcheshireUK
Reviews.Content: the suite was beautiful ,clean well laid out and very comfortable . there was alot of outside noise due to the location (hospitals and fire station plus the industrial area to the rear )but the unusual shape of the building cleanliness and friendliness of the staff plus the courtisy shuttle bus made up for the noise .i would stay here again and recomend it to friends .

Reviews.Title: “Clean Great Value Stay”
Reviews.Author: maddmurf
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for a short week to see my favorite team, the Red Sox, play in Fenway. Priced many hotels closer to downtown, but found them to be many$$'s. We got a fair deal on this property. It is clean, comfortable, and the customer service is the best. If you need any info., just ask the front desk. Very friendly and very helpful. We did use the free transfer s few time, but it is very busy and wastes alot of you time waiting. Not anyone's fault, just too busy for just one guy! They need 2 transfers. We chose the subway instead. It is a few blocks from the motel, but easy to get to all the popular sites in Boston. The breakfast was fine. A little crowded, but we just took our food up to our room when it was too crowded. I would definately stay here again. Best bang for the buck, and we just loved our room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper than downtown but a "downmarket" location”
Reviews.Author: vaorbust
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very interesting - a round brick building ! The room we had was clean and of course an odd size. It had a tiny sepatate front area with an uncomfortable sofabed and a mini-bar. The bedroom was small but adequate; ditto nice bathroom. Staff was friendly. There is parking. The area for this hotel is, as the Brits say, "downmarket." I would chartacterize it as "gritty." There is a restaurant across the street, but we didn't really want to venture outside after dark. We did hear sirens all night, but it turns out the hotel is quite near a major Boston hospital. The hotel has van service, although we did not avail ourselves of that. It was was easy to get to, but for the price (about $160. a night) I am not sure I would stay here again due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but awful upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Lilu2011
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to Boston and after reading many reviews, we chose this hotel. Pros: Great location - we used the shuttle and also walkd to the subway Great staff - very friendly and helpful Free parking and shuttle Cons: Room - we were upgraded to the 6th floor (Club floor) and our room smelled like cigarette although it was non-smoking and there were ants in the bathroom. As well, we were told we would have complimentatry water bottles when we checked in and when we got to the room, there were none. We went back to the desk and were told they had run out! Breakfast area - too small and with the slow toaster and the waffle machine, it was hard to get to even get a coffee because of the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: mvdhill
Reviews.Content: We were hear for the Boston Marathon ad though busy the staff remained helpful and pleasant. The location was great, the room had 2 beds PLUS a pullout sofa! Nice dining room with lovely breakfast. The best thing is the hotel shuttle takes you anywhere within 2 miles and even picks you up for your return..and many things are within 2 miles of this place. It is near many tourist places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Less Expensive Option for the Boston Marathon”
Reviews.Author: ltuck
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are really hard to come by during marathon weekend. So when I got a room here on Orbitz, I took it - not really expecting much. But this hotel turned out to be quite perfect. Big rooms, friendly staff, a decent breakfast buffet, and a very handy shuttle service that drove us back and forth to the expo whenever we needed it. On race day, the shuttle even drove me out to the bus pick up area for free! Everyone in the hotel was so nice and took care of our every needs. The location was not so great, but with the shuttle, that was never a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TGMFan
Reviews.Content: My daughter was scheduled for fetal heart intervention on her unborn son at Brigham & Women's and Children's Hospital. The info from the hospital recommended this hotel. The shuttle service is probably the most valuable amenity offered! Pablo (and his evening counterpart) took us to subway stops, shopping centers, the hospital, restaurants. Pretty much everywhere we needed to go! Called the hotel when we were ready to go back and we were always picked up within 15 minutes. We found Christina at the front desk to be the most friendly of the front desk folks. We upgraded on night 3 (with the BW membership) to an Executive Suite--even after being told that it's basically the same size room, but with a flat-screen tv and free bottled water. That was true. The normal price is $10 more/night; I wouldn't spend an extra $10 for a tv and water (especially since the only free bottled water we received was what was sitting on the end table when we moved up--none any other day). Our 6 night stay was very pleasant here. Rooms were clean, we didn't hear noise from any other rooms. We'd stay here again. The little restaurant/deli across the street (New Market Pizza & Grill) makes the most AMAZING pizza we have ever eaten!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, free parking, but not convenient”
Reviews.Author: nhJenny
Reviews.Content: My husband is a BW Rewards diamond elite member, so we used points for this one night stay. The hotel is easy to get to and the parking is free, which is a plus for Boston. The room was clean, although there was little water pressure in the shower. This isn't a big deal, but it was a cold weekend and a nice hot shower would have been nice! On the downside, there was some miscommunication at check-in because apparently this BW doesn't have the same policy of accepting reservations through points as any other BW we've stayed at. We were expected to have a certificate provided by BW in order to check in, which we'd never heard of. After showing the reservation confirmation email I had received on my smartphone, we still weren't able to check in so I had to go to the business center and actually print out that very same email. A printed confirmation sufficed. A little over the top, but not a deal breaker. We weren't offered a room on the BW Rewards floor. Not sure if there are any special perks associated, and not a big deal to us, but just an observation. Probably most concerning was what happened the morning of our departure. We left the room to grab some coffee and upon returning the housekeeping cart was outside the room and the door was wide open (the Do Not Disturb sign was on the door). The housekeeper wasn't in the room and was nowhere in the area. We had not packed up yet so a wallet, iPod and phone were sitting on the counter in full view of the hallway. I don't know how long the door had been open, but we were not impressed and packed up our stuff and left. All in all, the place is clean and inexpensive, but we probably won't return unless we're stuck and can't find another option closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Why didn't I stay here the other times I was in Boston?”
Reviews.Author: lorijc_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! One of the best I've every stayed in. Friendly staff, spotless room, and very comfortable, as well. We were visiting our son in college; and this is the first time we tried the Roundhouse. It will be the only place we stay from now on. Reasonably priced; and no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Most Caring, compassionate people, who's service was above and beyond the norm.”
Reviews.Author: TheDrakes
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Roundhouse because of a loved one being in the hospital at Boston Medical. The staff there treated us like family and had genuine concern and compassion for why we were there and treated us so well in every aspect of our stay. We as a family are forever grateful to the Roundhouse in Boston for their hospitality toward us when we were going through an extremely difficult time in our family. They are the BEST!! from the front desk to the housing staff, to the amazing lady helping us with our breakfast, to the shuttle guys who were amazing. Not one place were they lacking!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit47
Reviews.Content: Get Hotel.The staff were excellent and very friendly and helpfull. Free parking was a plus and the shuttle was excellent.Great place to stay if you are going to a ball game or hockey game.Will be back .The staff offered great service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Reaganomics82
Reviews.Content: Seriously I've stayed in more expensive places and this room was by far more clean, spacious and the staff here was awesome! It's not in the greatest part of town, but the front desk will call you a cab wherever you need to go. (and there's a free shuttle service but we were in too much of a rush to wait). The free breakfast was crowded but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: AnabelT32
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with a few girlfriends. The front desk staff was super helpful and awesome! Breakfast can get crazy but it's worth the wait. I took food up to my room when there were no seats available. I can't say anything about the area as we just jumped into a cab but I had no problem with where the hotel was located. Our room was clean and the beds were super comfortable. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Good Value”
Reviews.Author: 60745traveller
Reviews.Content: OK, its a bit out of Boston requiring a taxi ride or shuttle into Town. Can be a bit noisy sometimes outside due to wretched sirens. However, its has got to be the best Best Western I have ever stayed in, and I am actually writing this in their business centre (free) because I am am staying there right now. The breakfast is very good, the suites are absolutely excellent with AC, two TV's large bathroom. It is without doubt stunning value for money, and particularly in Boston which is extremely expensive. I am from UK, and hotels there are generally expensive. This is not, and I would honestly recommend it to any Btit's coming to Boston. The staff are friendly and helpful. Overall, outstanding value for money for Boston. Keith Reynolds

Reviews.Title: “First of all, this hotel is not in a good...”
Reviews.Author: AuburnFamilyTraveler
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is not in a good neighborhood. Don't stay here if you want to do a lot of walking around at night. They do have a free shuttle that will take you to local transportation stations, but the driver does expect to be tipped. Room was spacious and clean but there were no curtains that fully shut which REALLY bothered me since people from the business behind the hotel could see in our room windows (we were on the first floor). I didn't find the front desk staff very helpful, but the woman running the free contenential breakfast was very nice, and the breakfast itself was extensive and a very nice bonus. All and all it was ok, but...the neighborhood made it a pass for me on any future visits to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: LymingtonHaw
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston and after much searching found a room with two double beds in the Best Western. The hotel is on the south side and has easy access to the centre by train or taxi. The receptionists were so helpful and one lady particularly ( sorry cant remember your name) was like the tourist information centre all on her own! She printed out whale watching tour tickets that would save us money and gave us plenty of great tips. Thank you. The room we were allocated was spacious and although we were sharing with friends, there was enough room. Breakfast was a bit of a bunfight but was adequate to start your day. Overall, for Boston this is a fair priced hotel with great access and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “small suites nice but disappointing location”
Reviews.Author: Hal45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for a 1st time experience of Boston. Were not told when booking, that the airport shuttle [$16 for 2] had to be reserved 24hrs in advance, therefore had to pay for taxi to the hotel. Not a great start but kudos to the manager - we received the fare off our 1st nights room rate. Were upgraded to 6th floor suite w.r.t. being B.W. rewards member which meant one could order minimalist continental breakfast items to be delivered to the room from a card to be hung on the door handle the night before. The room was quite comfortable, a mini suite with a separate bedroom, 2 TV's, mini bar fridge, microwave and coffeemaker and ensuite BR. King bed with duvet nice, however only the sheer bedroom curtains would draw closed which made sleeping a bit difficult as the street lights shone into the room. The complimentary continental breakfast [coffee, tea, juices, cold hard boiled eggs, cereals, bagels/bread via the slowest toaster known to man, yogurts, oranges/apples and some breakfast pastries with a self serve waffle maker Sun] was quite adequate but seating limited - easy to take tray up to one's room. Complimentary internet near elevators with 2 computers and free printing was nice touch. Available internet connection in one's suite. The complimentary shuttle to T-stops and major shopping centre was helpful - most of the drivers were quite pleasant and helpful. The main drawback to this hotel was the location - on the outskirts of town in an industrial setting with only MacDonald's and a pizza joint across the street. Had a 10 min walk to the nearest bus stop to then access the subway and downtown/attractions. Would be worth the extra cost to stay closer to Boston central and avoid the extra time/hassle of buses and subways back and forth esp evenings for dinner. Nothing to do around this hotel in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again--did not meet our expectations!"”
Reviews.Author: FamilytimeRichmond
Reviews.Content: Our family came to Boston for a mini-vacation. Our travel agent recommended the hotel and we looked at the website for it. The website made the hotel look absolutely marvelous! Nothing like it really is! First, the neighborhood was scary! We were not comfortable walking anywhere--we really were not close to anything so walking was not even a good option! We tried to walk to one of the T stations but turned around when a couple of Boston residents told us we were in a bad part of town! The shuttle service was nice and the drivers great BUT they need another one--we frequently had to wait 30 or more minutes! It would also have been nice if they could take you to the historic section of Boston. The best we could do was take a shuttle to a T stop and then take the T to the historic area. The front desk personnel was okay -- but they were not very friendly or helpful! They acted as if it was a bother to even answer our questions! When we asked about walking to places, we were told "go ahead"--nothing about being careful in the neighborhood! The breakfast was relatively good but it was limited in the choices and squeezed into a very tiny space! It was hard to move around and the layout of the condiments/forks/etc was awkward. Give it more space and maybe throw in some donuts with the muffins! Our room was adequate--a little drab and in need of updating--the sleep sofa was uncomfortable but it was nice to have a refrigerator in the room. The internet service was very slow! We would not recommend tourists use this hotel! If we were coming to Boston for the medical centers, it would be appropriate but not for touring the city itself!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: Optomom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight so we could go to the 4th of July Fireworks. We stayed here for several reasons. First, we could bring our 2 small dogs at an additional charge of $20 per dog. This was wonderful for us! Secondly, we got free parking and free continental breakfast. Add all these things toegther and for the AAA discounted price we got, it was a deal! Yes, it is true that we were in the South End and the neighborhood isn't the absolute best. But at no time did I ever feel unsafe. I have lived in Bsoton before and done my internships in the South End so I knew how the area was before. Yes, there are lots of non-white people, but don't be scared by that. It's just a different neighborhood so don't let your pre-conceived notions determine where you should stay. The hotel was clean and the suite was adorable! Spacious and cute! Staff was okay. Neither friendly nor rude. They serve their purpose. It's not the 4 Seasons, mind you and I could personally care less. I loved the on-demand shuttle that picked us up and dropped us off all day as needed. Some short amount of waiting but no biggie. The shuttle driver, Carlos, was a bit crazy with his driving with our small toddler in the van but he never hit anyone...so yayy! Hahaha! Typical Boston for you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, not so nice location.”
Reviews.Author: RWeb
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and comfortable. It's surroundings, however, left much to be desired. Don't plan on wandering around the local area. The rooms are large and if you are a gold crown member, you can pre-order your breakfast and they will deliver it to your room! We did not make use of the shuttle as we rented a vehicle, but it always seemed to be available for use. It was a little loud, due to the businesses around the hotel, but Boston is a big city and that comes with the territory. Would I recommend this hotel. Yes and no. If you don't mind the bad location then yes. When I return to Boston I will probably look for something more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vladi D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel for 3 nights, following a local friend's recommendation. The hotel has discounts for visitors of several medical centers in Boston, which is quite good if you come to teach, learn or receive treatment of any kind. They also have a complimentary shuttle that would take you there and back, free of charge, as well as to several "T" (subway / tram) stations in the area. The rooms are not very big, but they're very nice and functional. These are actually mini-suites with a small living room / office / kitchenette and a bigger bedroom. There's a flat screen TV in the bedroom, and a small regular TV in the living room. There's also a fridge and a microwave. Wi-Fi is free, however the connection speed tends to be quite low. The rooms are nicely furnished (old-style, but new and well-kept). The bathroom includes the basic amenities, and they even can supply stuff like a comb, a toothbrush / toothpaste or shaving foam, in case you forgot them. All in all, it's a nice business hotel, that may serve the occasional scientist / doctor coming to visit Boston's medical facilities. A word about the free shuttle - it is a very comfortable service, however there's only one shuttle, and all the guests would like to use it in the same time. Waiting times, especially when the shuttle takes people to the medical centers during rush hours, can be very lengthy (20-30 minutes). You'd better call a cab... The neighbourhood is a bit scary, and there's a homeless shelter someplace nearby, but I wouldn't worry too much about that...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: upsidedown_i
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Roundhouse Suites are gorgeous. We really benefited from the kitchenette. The staff were okay--not rude but not overly helpful. The shuttle service was good, although during the "on" season it does not go to Faneuil Hall like the website says. I called and told them to change it. The area is not good. There are lots of homeless people hanging around. We did not feel safe walking at night. There is a fantastic pizza place right across from the hotel. Definitely check it out. We could walk to the subway, or take the shuttle, but the shuttle was sometimes a 20 minute wait, and the walk is only about 15. The shuttle driver is an absolute sweetheart. The noise from the street (tons of sirens) was somewhat disruptive but we slept well despite it. The complimentary breakfast is fantastic. They even have a waffle iron and boiled eggs. Overall, very nice hotel in a less than nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good do not let area mislead you”
Reviews.Author: superdsi
Reviews.Content: The area is not the best. South end of Boston. The hotel has been renovated. We had a suite, 2 televsions, free parking and breakfast for $109. Shuttle to the downtown in 15 minutes. Very good pick for anyone staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: hmarkman
Reviews.Content: As a person who travels quite a lot and works in the service/hospitality industry, I was extremely disappointed by the way I was treated by this front desk staff. I have stayed at numerous Best Westerns, both in and out of Boston, and I will never go back here again, even though the rooms weren't that bad. Besides the uncomfortable bed and the outdated decor, it was a good size. But the women who work the front desk, including the manager, need to take a class on hospitality and what that actually means. If I were the owner of this particular Best Western, I would seriously consider some training for this staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: candyt71
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and the staff was courteous and helpful. I had a problem w/ the room key and the front desk had a janitor up to help me within minutes. The shuttle was a nice plus. The only negative aspects were that the hotel is not in a great neighborhood and there are not a lot of restaurants or shopping within walking distance. Also, internet connection in business center was painfully slow. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: finch6789
Reviews.Content: So of course when you book the room, they're not forthcoming with the fact that Boston Medical Center is a stone's throw away, and they have a heavy equipment yard in the back that starts gettin' busy at the crack of dawn. That was, and is, always my big gripe with any hotel. They always give me a room above a bar, or next to the generator room, or next to a convention room that's having a bachelor party. My bad, need to learn to ask. So the cons: 1. The area is not so nice and really doesn't accommodate a family walking to a restaurant nearby or entertainment nearby... gotta take a shuttle or a taxi. There are panhandlers and gang graffiti about - not too comfortable walking my 4 year old around. The establishments nearby were garage rentals, gas stations, dry cleaners, etc. There are no nice views from any of the rooms. Ours overlooked a heavy equipment yard. 2. Also, one of the two front desk receptionists was none too friendly. I can't say she was unprofessional, because she did her job. But to get her to talk was like pulling teeth, and we got to the point where we were afraid to bother her. 3. One of those places you have to ask for a key to use the bathroom while in the lobby, waiting or having breakfast. So you have to wait in line, then ask, the return it. And twice in 2 days (remember I'm with a small child), the bathroom was being serviced, and we had to walk down into this basement and find our way to an unmarked bathroom door that never had soap. A little inconvenient. 4. The beds... ... horrible. And when we asked for an extra blanket they said they were "out". Pros: 1. The 3 men who shuttled the guests about were bar none with their friendliness, knowledge of the area and they're very willing to help. Loved them. 2. free shuttle to/from Museum of Fine Arts. Wonderful. 3. For the MOST part, (except for one), the staff was great. 4. GREAT complimentary breakfast. More than your usual fare when given a free meal. So, next time I'm in Boston, I think I'll get a place that's closer to downtown where one could walk around to restaurants, shops, events, etc., and a somewhat cleaner area, say, like near the Prudential Center. Reminds me of the upper West side of Manhattan. I don't know why other reviewers said the beds were comfortable, unless they're used to sleeping on a 20 year old futon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GretaM1
Reviews.Content: The room was perfect for a family of 4,neat ,clean,breakfast ready in the am was always good.Nice Price W/AAA discount.Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: annonRI
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. The continental breakfast is great for the price (Free and comes with waffles). Inexpensive hotel / clean rooms / good service. The beds are comfortable and the people working there are very nice. Free parking (albeit not in the best area)... A free shuttle. Free Wi-Fi. I've stayed here 3 times and have never had a bad experience. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: KristieM1
Reviews.Content: The room was a tad outdated but nice and clean, including the bathroom (VERY important to me). The TVs are in need of replacement but we weren't in the room very much so it didn't really make a difference. There was a free shuttle to take you around town, which was GREAT, especially when we had to get to and from Fenway Park. The driver was very friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the city and what it had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb - Our Second Visit - Immaculate”
Reviews.Author: douglashageman
Reviews.Content: Immaculate Facility - Friendly Staff and **Good** (fresh!) Coffee for FREE to boot! My wife & stayed here on one previous occasion entirely by chance, but were impressed with our treatment and the facility itself. This past weekend, having not saved the information we found ourselves wandering about in the general direction until we found the place again whereupon I saved everything in my PDA. Once again we were met with friendly courteous people, a spotless suite as opposed the more austere room we had paid almost 3 times more for downtown only a year ago. FREE guarded parking (downtown it costs another 40 overnight and the vehicle is parked blocks away and unguarded). Easily the best bargain in the Boston area and close to everything.â€Ž

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Roundhouse Suites good place”
Reviews.Author: missduck69
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms, breakfast was the standard fare. Computers in the business center were very slow so be sure to bring your lap top with free wi fi. Free printing in the business center if you can stand the slowness. Front desk is very helpful with finding times and directions to places you want to go (and it is much faster this way). Free shuttle service to various places such as the Prudential and different subway lines. We enjoyed our stay there very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inside but not outside”
Reviews.Author: Love711
Reviews.Content: Arrived late the first night to find out the free shuttle had stopped so my 80 year old mother and myself were directed by the desk girls to walk across a very busy street for a bar type meal. Not a good area to for 2 women to be walking alone!! There were young boys in the middle of the streets, walking between cars asking for money. Hotel is across the street from Boston Medical Center, there were loud sirens going off but the last night it was pretty quiet. The complementary newspaper turned out to be a paper in the lobby/breakfast area. The room was clean, we loved the breakfast and the frig/micro/safe in the comfortable room. For $8 per person they will pick-up/deliver you to the airport. Oh, wi-fi free!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Return- you should too”
Reviews.Author: renber
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Boston area which I visited recently on Business. The Hotel was very clean and room large with excellent decor, included continental breakfast was a plus. The free shuttle service to various locations was a true gem in addition they offer a very discounted airport shuttle ($8).

Reviews.Title: “NO RETURN SHUTTLE. NO A/C.”
Reviews.Author: got2getaway_9
Reviews.Content: Roundhouse Suites advertises shuttle service to be included in the cost of the rooms to certain areas of Boston. We were left with no way back from downtown, at night because the shuttle broke down. Our room was street front. The central A/C system was broken and we had a portable A/C unit in our room that roared and then shut off both night before midnight. It was warm and muggy and we had to have the window open. VERY NOISY road outside our room = no nights sleep. The rooms were clean, but I would not return for another stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very deceptive compared to what their website promises”
Reviews.Author: anne47_1998
Reviews.Content: Overall the room was very nice, or would have been had it not been for many small issues we encountered over the course of our stay. The first time we tried to use the shower the water backed up in the tub. Upon calling the front desk a maintenance worker came quickly to attend to the problem, however, left a mess in the tub of hair and grime after telling us the problem had been a hairclog from previous customers. Gross. The dirt from the tub was then transfered to the toilet, floor and handle as he disposed of the clog. The room smelled a bit musty upon arrival and began to intensify by the end of the first afternoon. We specifically called ahead to ask about the shuttle service and spoke to the front desk directly and not the main best western phone number. We chose this hotel as we were told the shuttle takes us directly to Fanneil Hall and leaves every 20 minutes or so. When I called the front desk after arrival to find out when the next shuttle was leaving we had to wait 40 minutes for the shuttle and it only dropped us off at the Subway station down the street and did not take us to the listed location as we had confirmed. We would not have stayed at this location had we known this as other hotels in the area drop patrons off at predetermined locations in Boston, not just at the subway station. We also were not told that we were going to be dropped off at a Subway station until we loaded the bus and by that time did not have time to try to figure out what subway line we needed to take or how to do so. We were unable to understand the driver and another hotel patron was kind enough to give us his information and direct us where to go- something the hotel should have provided long before we loaded the shuttle. The continental breakfast was poorly run. Many customers were complaining at the length of time it took to prepare their breakfasts as the toaster took at least 5 mintes to toast and the organization of the breakfast caused patrons to go to different ends of the area for items that should have been grouped together. Cream cheese, for example, was not placed near the cutlery and so people had to push through to pick up necessary items. These issues caused the area to be too crowded to meet the needs of customers. The fruit was also quite damaged looking. Finally, cookies were supposed to be provided from 5-7pm and at 5:30pm when we arrived at the lobby there were not any left and we were told that no more would be provided. At the same time we tried to pour a cup of coffee that is supposed to be availabe 24/7 and there was not enough to pour a cup and when the front desk was notified the staff did not quickly tend to this issue either. The complimentary computers in the business centre were very slow to use. Patrons were waiting in the centre for others to finish using one computer rather than attempting to use the second computer as it was so slow and useless. I am truly not one to complain and am usually a fairly easy going individual. These issues, however, caused us to have a very poor outlook on this location and we will not be returning. Though some of the issues may seem like small insignificant problems it is often the small things that count in customer service and the way these small things are tended to. We were very disapointed by the level of customer service provided at this location and it will strongly keep us from recommending this location to others. We have visited Boston numerous times and will continue to do so and given our experience at this location we will likely try another brand of hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tanoc728
Reviews.Content: My sisters family and my family recently stayed at this hotel. We spent the day sight seeing in the city of Boston. Upon returning to the hotel we discovered that both of our cars were broken into. When we went in to the front desk the first words out of their mouths were "We are not responsible for your vehicles." We called the police ourselves, when he arrived he stated that he was at the hotel 2 nights ago for the same problem! This was very discouraging to here. We booked the Best Western because we assumed that it was a family oreintated facilty. We did not feel safe at all. Something needs to be done to protect all of your customers who stay at your hotel. We didnt not feel that when we left your hotel that it was going to be any different for the next group of visitors--HORRIBLE!! Please try to make sure people are safe while visiting your hotels! DO YOURSELVES A FAVOR AND STAY AT A DIFFERENT HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Western”
Reviews.Author: 4thskftrvl
Reviews.Content: From the pictures, this hotel seemed to be the perfect fit. My daughter and I were visiting colleges in the Boston area, with a particular interest in Boston University. Granted, the hotel was less than 2 miles from the campus, but, boy, does 2 miles make a difference. The way this hotel is advertised is very deceiving- it is in a TERRIBLE area. Had it not been a Sunday night at 11 o'clock after 5 hours of driving, I would have left. This is a very unsafe place, especially for 2 females traveling alone. Furthermore, they put my daughter and I on the first floor, where there were IRON bars on the windows- needless to say, my daughter and I felt extremely uncomfortable with these visibly crude fixtures. I politely asked the front desk to please, move my daughter and I off the first floor (as we did not feel safe with iron bars on the windows) and explained that I would be willing to pay for an upgrade. However, the attendant rudely retorted that since we made the reservations online, there was no upgrade available, and nothing we could do other than leave. Furthermore, the parking was incredibly inconvenient, and while free and "on sight" (usually a rare gem in the Boston area) I would have rather paid for overnight parking than park in an unlit parking lot with no security. While they say "free continental breakfast" expect to be underwhelmed with stale pastries and warm juice. This is certainly the worst Boston, and the Best Western has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price with a story!”
Reviews.Author: pathbunny
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a good place to stay. Large clean room with small refrigerator and microwave, the neighborhood is not so bad unless you are not used to a diverse culture in a big city. Shuttle staff superb and knowledgeable. We ended up using the T system and once we got the hang of it, the sky was the limit on where to go. The only bad thing was breakfast area very congested once the tall ships came into town. We only got coffee and juice on our last day and headed out to a restaurant on the highway. Now that we know the T system, we might stay farther out next time if we can get a decent price. Our main requirement for a hotel is clean and safe. This was both. It also offered free parking, unusual for Boston!

Reviews.Title: “good staff, great rooms...bad location”
Reviews.Author: essentials
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never been to Boston and we were looking forward to spending a wonderful visit in town. My husband had accummulated travel points towards a credit to any Best Western hotel. The roundhouse was highly recommended to us.by the Best Western travel guide. He told us that it was ideally situated for our purpose. We wished to view the historical sights in Boston. When taking our taxi to the hotel, the driver winced and repeated the name of the hotel. He quickly redeamed the situation by telling my husband and I that "we would be fine", While the hotel itself is well managed, it cannot overcome its poor location. My husband and I were accosted by panhandlers as soon as we arrived at our destination. Walking around in the neighbourhood was out of the question. The hotel provides a shuttle to alleviate the problems of getting to destinations in Boston. Unfortunately, our movements were limited to the availability of the shuttle. The worst impact of the poor location is the active nightly hustle and bustle of women and men conducting business and exchanging loud explicatives to voice their displeasure. Those sounds were broken up with the revving of cars who thought they were racing at the Le Mans. Sleeping at night was not part of my routine at the hotel. As they say in real estate. location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “So close to Boston Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: passionate-gardener
Reviews.Content: My grandson was going to be in the Boston Medical Center for three days and I wanted to be there for my son and daughter-in-law. When I telephoned the hospital, the person suggested the Hampton Inn and Best Western Roundhouse. I selected Best Western because I like the fact that each hotel in their chain is unique. This is a landmark building. The hospital is 2 1/2 blocks away and the free shuttle service was fabulous. The driver picked me up at the hospital at the appointed time, dropped me off at a shopping center and picked me up a half hour later and took me back to the hotel. I was very impressed. The young ladies at the reception desk were wonderful. One day I mentioned that I liked chocolate and the next evening when I returned from the hospital, one of them presented me with a large bar of Lindt dark chocolate. Because of the proximity to the hospital, I was awakened several times during the night by the sound of sirens. Ear plugs are recommended if you are on the Mass. Avenue side of the hotel. The prices are low because the location is not in the most elegant part of town. But if you need to be near the Boston Medical Center, this was the perfect spot!

Reviews.Title: “good place ...for boston”
Reviews.Author: burgerfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days, and the bad reviews about the location didn`t bother me, because ...you visit Boston.... Sure it was loud and a busy intersection plus a huge!! gasstation is around the corner, but overall it was a good place to stay. Just use earplugs and it will work out. Staff could improve a little , because the wireless connection did not work very well, and fixing it was a little difficult... Overall , you visit Boston and you could pay much more, and have the same problems.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonbly priced but not very central”
Reviews.Author: Americaine-in-Paris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a close walk to the T but the hotel does have a shuttle service. We would take the shuttle in the mornings but could have a bit of a wait for it. The shuttle drivers are quite nice. At the end of the day, it was easier to just take the bus back to the hotel. It was not in an area where I felt comfortable walking at night with two kids but the bus stop is right by the hotel. The beds were comfortable but the sofabed was not. The room was well equiped and comfortable. We used the frig - it was quite a walk to the closest store to purchase beer but there is a mini-mart at the adjacent gas station. The breakfast bar was well done and plentiful. Since hotels in the center of town are much more expensive, this was a good value, just a bit far from things.
